choices.C: A single document, if that is what management asked for.
choices.B: Failing unit tests, to identify acceptance tests for the next Sprint.
choices.D: A valuable, useful increment that meets the Definition of Done.
choices.A: An Increment of software with minor known bugs in it.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

questions.question_text: Which of these may a Scrum Team deliver at the end of a Sprint? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.A: The Product Owner can be represented by a committee or a team of people.
choices.B: The Product Owner is accountable for ordering the Product Backlog.
choices.C: The Scrum Team can have multiple Product Owners.
choices.D: The Product Owner is one person.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D

questions.question_text: Which of the following are true about the Product Owner? (Choose two.)
Which three behaviors demonstrate that a Scrum Team is self-managing? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: this question is not arranged well. why are there two c's in the option?

correct is: 
A. The Scrum Team has all the skills needed to create an increment.
B. Developers collaboratively selecting their own work during the Sprint.
C. The Developers create their own Sprint Backlog, reflecting all work that is part of the Definition of Done.

choices.B: Developers collaboratively selecting their own work during the Sprint.
choices.D: The Scrum Master is no longer needed.
choices.C:
The Developers create their own Sprint Backlog, reflecting all work that is part of the Definition of Done.
C. The Scrum Team members are working within the boundaries of their functional description and nicely handing off work from analyst to developer to tester to integration.
choices.A: The Scrum Team has all the skills needed to create an increment.
choices.E: Stakeholders are attending the Daily Scrum to check progress and work with the Scrum Master to optimize the functional scope for the Sprint.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Product owner and developers.

choices.B: The Scrum Master and the Developers.
choices.A: The Scrum Master, project manager and the Developers
choices.D: The Product Owner and all stakeholders.
choices.C: The Product Owner and the Developers.

questions.question_text: When the Developers determine that they will not be able to finish the complete forecast, who has to be present when reviewing and adjusting the Sprint work selected? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.F: Escalate team conflicts to functional line managers.
choices.D: Monitor the progress of the Developers.
choices.C: Assign tasks with the Scrum Team.
choices.B: Facilitate inspection and adaptation opportunities as requested or needed.
choices.E: Coaching the team members in self-management.
choices.A: Ensure the Product Owner attends all Scrum events.

questions.question_text: During the Sprint, the Scrum Master’s role is to do which two of the following: (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B & E Developers are Selbst- Organized

Selected Answer: BE
B and E

B. Faciliter les opportunités d'inspection et d'adaptation selon les demandes ou les besoins : Le Scrum Master facilite les réunions et les événements Scrum, tels que les Daily Scrum, la Revue de Sprint et la Rétrospective de Sprint, afin que l'équipe puisse inspecter l'avancement du travail et s'adapter en conséquence.

E. Coaching des membres de l'équipe dans l'autogestion : Le Scrum Master guide l'équipe dans l'auto-organisation et l'autogestion. Il les aide à prendre des décisions collectives, à résoudre les problèmes et à devenir de plus en plus autonomes.
